text:
The report explores how different policy scenarios could affect various industries, as well as their potential impacts on employment, income, and economic growth.
New Climate Change Bill Could Have Significant Impacts on Local Economies Across the United States (RAND, 2022)
Climate Change Adaptation in Coastal Cities: Policies, Strategies, and Plans (NAP, 2020) — This National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine publication discusses the need for coastal cities to adapt to the impacts of climate change. The report provides an overview of existing policies, strategies, and plans for addressing climate change in these areas.
Infrastructure Planning and Policy for the 21st Century (TRB, 2021) — This Transportation Research Board report examines the challenges and opportunities facing infrastructure planning and policy in the United States. It highlights the importance of considering resilience, equity, and sustainability in infrastructure decision-making.
Incorporating the Cost of Carbon into Federal Decision Making (Executive Office of the President, 2023) — This report outlines an interim estimate of the social cost of carbon (SC-CO2), which can be used to quantify the benefits of reducing greenhouse gas emissions. The document explains how this metric can inform federal decisions related to climate change mitigation.
Addressing Climate Migration and Displacement: A Framework for Governments and Other Stakeholders (NRC, 2022) — This National Research Council report presents a framework for governments and other stakeholders to address climate migration and displacement.
